poem.title: South-Facing Stele
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The raven took instruction for a thousand years From Brother North, who one day tried to tell him what to do. Instruction yes, instructions no, said crow, whose zeal For selfhood kept him this side of enlightenment, South of a tantric pass. Look out behind you, Brother North! But no: the squeal of steel on iron rail. Thy Corporation come to steal his ministry, Bros and sisters fled south. Let them in then seal the col, said the Raven Crown; Their temporal allegiance is to me, defer to North on larger matters. But no: good Brother North consoles his kin in every land but Middle Corp And this.
